trans-unit.source: For more details about disks, see <link><linkText>About Disks and VHDs for Virtual Machines</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For more details about disks, see <link><linkText>About Disks and VHDs for Virtual Machines</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: How to: Attach an empty disk
trans-unit.target: How to: Attach an empty disk

trans-unit.source: Attaching an empty disk is the simpler way to add a data disk, because Azure creates the .vhd file for you and stores it in the storage account.
trans-unit.target: Attaching an empty disk is the simpler way to add a data disk, because Azure creates the .vhd file for you and stores it in the storage account.

trans-unit.source: Open Azure CLI for Mac, Linux, and Windows and connect to your Azure subscription.
trans-unit.target: Open Azure CLI for Mac, Linux, and Windows and connect to your Azure subscription.

trans-unit.source: See [Connect
trans-unit.target: See [Connect

trans-unit.source: to Azure from Azure CLI](../articles/xplat-cli-connect.md) for more details.
trans-unit.target: to Azure from Azure CLI](../articles/xplat-cli-connect.md) for more details.

trans-unit.source: Make sure you are in Azure Service Management mode, which is the default by typing `azure config
trans-unit.target: Make sure you are in Azure Service Management mode, which is the default by typing `azure config

trans-unit.source: mode asm`.
trans-unit.target: mode asm`.

trans-unit.source: Use the command azure vm disk attach-new to create and attach a new disk as shown below.
trans-unit.target: Use the command azure vm disk attach-new to create and attach a new disk as shown below.

trans-unit.source: Note that the
trans-unit.target: Note that the

trans-unit.source: ubuntuVMasm will be replaced by the name of the Linux Virtual Machine that you have created in your subscription.
trans-unit.target: ubuntuVMasm will be replaced by the name of the Linux Virtual Machine that you have created in your subscription.

trans-unit.source: The number 30 is the size of the disk in GB in this example.
trans-unit.target: The number 30 is the size of the disk in GB in this example.

trans-unit.source: After the data disk is created and attached, it's listed in the output of `azure vm disk list
trans-unit.target: After the data disk is created and attached, it's listed in the output of `azure vm disk list

trans-unit.source: How to: Attach an existing disk
trans-unit.target: How to: Attach an existing disk

trans-unit.source: Attaching an existing disk requires that you have a .vhd available in a storage account.
trans-unit.target: Attaching an existing disk requires that you have a .vhd available in a storage account.

trans-unit.source: Open Azure CLI for Mac, Linux, and Windows and connect to your Azure subscription.
trans-unit.target: Open Azure CLI for Mac, Linux, and Windows and connect to your Azure subscription.

trans-unit.source: See [Connect
trans-unit.target: See [Connect

trans-unit.source: to Azure from Azure CLI](../articles/xplat-cli-connect.md) for more details.
trans-unit.target: to Azure from Azure CLI](../articles/xplat-cli-connect.md) for more details.

trans-unit.source: Make sure you are in Azure Service Management mode, which is the default.
trans-unit.target: Make sure you are in Azure Service Management mode, which is the default.

trans-unit.source: If you have changed
trans-unit.target: If you have changed

trans-unit.source: mode to Resource Management, simply revert by typing azure config mode asm.
trans-unit.target: mode to Resource Management, simply revert by typing azure config mode asm.

trans-unit.source: Find out if the VHD you want to attach is already uploaded to your Azure subscription by using:
trans-unit.target: Find out if the VHD you want to attach is already uploaded to your Azure subscription by using:

trans-unit.source: If you don't find the disk that you want to use, you may upload a local VHD to your subscription by using
trans-unit.target: If you don't find the disk that you want to use, you may upload a local VHD to your subscription by using

trans-unit.source: azure vm disk create or azure vm disk upload.
trans-unit.target: azure vm disk create or azure vm disk upload.

trans-unit.source: An example would be this:
trans-unit.target: An example would be this:

trans-unit.source: You may also use the azure vm disk upload command to upload a VHD to a specific storage account.
trans-unit.target: You may also use the azure vm disk upload command to upload a VHD to a specific storage account.

trans-unit.source: Read more about the commands to manage your Azure virtual machine data disks <link><linkText>over here</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: Read more about the commands to manage your Azure virtual machine data disks <link><linkText>over here</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Type the following command to attach the desired uploaded VHD to your virtual machine:
trans-unit.target: Type the following command to attach the desired uploaded VHD to your virtual machine:

trans-unit.source: Make sure to replace ubuntuVMasm with the name of your virtual machine, and myTestVhd with your desired VHD.
trans-unit.target: Make sure to replace ubuntuVMasm with the name of your virtual machine, and myTestVhd with your desired VHD.

trans-unit.source: You can verify if the disk is attached to the virtual machine with the command `azure vm disk list
trans-unit.target: You can verify if the disk is attached to the virtual machine with the command `azure vm disk list

trans-unit.source: <html></html>` as:
trans-unit.target: <html></html>` as:

trans-unit.source: After you add a data disk, you'll need to log on to the virtual machine and initialize the disk so the virtual machine can use the disk for storage.
trans-unit.target: After you add a data disk, you'll need to log on to the virtual machine and initialize the disk so the virtual machine can use the disk for storage.
